newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Weather slows movement.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Spring/White Wheat - Weather slows movement.

text.p: Snow, rain and soggy ground prevented grain movement from Minnesota to Oregon, grain dealers said.
Cash bids for wheat were sharply higher, but recent blizzard conditions in the Dakotas and Minnesota and soggy ground in Montana prevented farmers from trucking grain to dealers.

Heavy snowfall in the Dakotas and Minnesota since the weekend shut down some grain terminals. Snow was falling across Montana Monday but was "melting as fast as it is coming down," a Billings dealer said.
In Montana, soggy ground in some areas prevented farmers from positioning trucks under grain spouts to load grain, dealers said.
Minneapolis sources farmers would be unable to plant spring wheat until May, compared with a normal late April start.

In Savage, Minnesota, just south of Minnesota, high water on the Minnesota River will force elevators to suspend operations this week. The water has flooded roads and railroad tracks, halting movement to and from these terminals, dealers there said..
Spring Chg HRW 13pct Chg White Chg
